@usapilot
The airportlist.bin file is needed for the ipad only. If you download the ipad data, the file is already there. However the ipad data did not have the VFR charts that some of us needed. We can copy those charts from the PC data into ipad but then you need the airportlist.bin generated from the PC data. Otherwise you will still not see the VFR charts in the ipad.

Hey Guys, 1213 [IPAD] Available! http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7381703

For PC users who can't wait for the 1213 update: There is a way to use files from the IPAD to partially update the PC version.
Out of the latest IPAD torrent take the files airports.dbf, charts.ini charts.bin (-Documents-Data-Termcharts).
Rename airports.dbf to Airports.dbf and charts.bin to Charts.bin.
Copy these 3 files to your Jeppesen-Common-TerminalCharts folder on your PC to replace the older versions.
This will already update the terminal charts to the current version while we wait for the full PC update.

instructions for JV, FS

regarding JV/FS installation please note:
assuming your operating system is M$ Windoze 32bit..
a. no need to format/re-format  HDD ! (as I read elsewhere...) just uninstall the Jepp products.
b. use REGEDIT (from START>RUN etc.) to go to registry and [u]delete all JEPPESEN entries.[/u] (uninstall does leave traces...)
c. set computer date/time to 05 Jan 2009
d. install JV and/or FS normally ( codes in this forum and TPB ) 
e. use cycle 25/2008 0r 01/2009 for navdata update
f. run JV and activate via phone ( site code R00D-KCAB will work ! )
g. run FS and activate via phone ( site code R00D-KCAB will work ! )
h. set computer date/time back to TODAY's date
i. install the more recent cycle...DONE ! 
j. above for Jeppview 3.xx and Flitestar/Map v9.xx, for the newest "Jeppview for Windoze" check this forum for instructions (Jan-Feb posts).
